result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin A. Bartz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to 13CF437; with work release and transfer privileges

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin A. Bartz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DNA Sample language removed per Court

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with witnesses JLP, dob 10/10/80 and AMR, dob 6/1/80.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:54) Defendant Justin A. Bartz in custody via video with Intern Austin Heiman (Atty. Moeller) (will appoint).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. State requests $1,000 Cash Bond w/conditions; RD 3/2/15 at 2:30pm & JT 4/22/15 at 8:30am in Br. 2; Court sets $500.00 CASH BOND with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with witnesses, JLP, dob 10/10/80 and AMR, dob 6/1/80.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
